children.text:
In Fortran, the code could be:

program main
    implicit none
    character(1000000) :: S  ! Assuming maximum input size
    integer :: N, i, pos, bills
    integer, allocatable :: digits(:)

    read(*,*) S
    N = len_trim(S)
    allocate(digits(0:N+1))
    digits = 0

    do i = 0, N-1
        pos = N - i
        digits(i) = ichar(S(pos:pos)) - ichar('0')
    end do

    bills = 0

    do i = 0, N
        if (digits(i) == 10) then
            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
            digits(i) = 0
        end if

        if (digits(i) <5) then
            bills = bills + digits(i)
        else if (digits(i) ==5) then
            if (digits(i+1) >=5) then
                digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
            end if
            bills = bills +5
        else
            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1
            bills = bills + (10 - digits(i))
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
end if
    end do

    print *, bills

end program main

In Fortran, the code could be:

program main
    implicit none
    character(1000000) :: S  ! Assuming maximum input size
    integer :: N, i, pos, bills
    integer, allocatable :: digits(:)

    read(*,*) S
    N = len_trim(S)
    allocate(digits(0:N+1))
    digits = 0

    do i = 0, N-1
        pos = N - i
        digits(i) = ichar(S(pos:pos)) - ichar('0')
    end do

    bills = 0

    do i = 0, N
        if (digits(i) == 10) then
            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
            digits(i) = 0
        end if

        if (digits(i) <5) then
            bills = bills + digits(i)
        else if (digits(i) ==5) then
            if (digits(i+1) >=5) then
                digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
            end if
            bills = bills +5
        else
            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1
            bills = bills + (10 - digits(i))
        end if
    end do

    print *, bills

end program main
